decision_conditions: The development hereby approved shall be begun not later than three years from the date of this permission.Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 92 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

All brickwork shall be in Flemish bond with queen closers, and no soil ventilation pipes, air extraction pipes, boiler flues or ducting shall be fixed to the fabric of the building other than those shown on the approved drawings.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance also having regard to the setting of the nearby listed building.

Prior to the commencement of above ground works, additional drawings that show details of the below stated features by section and elevation at scales of between 1:20 and 1:1 as appropriate shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.The additional detailed drawings will show:o	Windows (including cills, reveals, heads)o	Doors (including jambs, reveals and heads)o	Shopfronts o	Decorative brickwork (including parapet, reveals/returns , lintels, cornice banding and chamfered corner 'specials')o	Decorative concrete panelso	Soffitso	ParapetsWorks shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details and shall be maintained as such.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance also having regard to the setting of the nearby listed building.

Prior to the commencement of above ground works, a rooftop plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. This plan shall show all structures and equipment which protrude above the roofplane including, but not limited to: lift over-runs; fall protection systems; renewable energy technologies; and, heating ventilation and air conditioning systems. Development shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details and shall be maintained as such.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance also having regard to the setting of the nearby listed building.

No soil ventilation pipes, air extraction pipes, boiler flues or ducting, or exterior fixtures, shall be fixed to the fabric of the building other than those shown on the approved drawings.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance also having regard to the setting of the nearby listed building.

The ductwork on the external flue shown in the approved plans and documents shall be painted in a matt finish in a dark colour to appropriately match the finish of the adjacent wall materials.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance also having regard to the setting of the nearby listed building.

Prior to the commencement of above ground works additional plans and details showing the location, design and specification of sustainable energy features including the solar PV panels, solar thermal collectors, and air source heat pumps described in the approved Energy Statement shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The approved sustainable energy features shall be installed and operational prior to the occupation of the development and shall be maintained and retained thereafter.Reason: In the interests of environmentally sustainable development and having regard to CO2 reduction targets and climate change.

Flank windows and those rear facing windows specified to be obscured in the approved plans and drawings shall be in obscured glass with an equivalent obscuration as level 3 on the Pilkington Obscuration Range. The glazing shall not be altered without the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To safeguard the privacy of the occupiers of adjoining and neighbouring properties.

Prior to the occupation of the development details of the design and location of privacy screening to external balconies and terraces must be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing. The approved privacy screens shall be installed prior to the occupation of the development and maintained and retained thereafter. Reason: To safeguard the privacy of the occupiers of adjoining and neighbouring properties.

Notwithstanding the approved documents, prior to the commencement of any development an updated Construction Management Plan must be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The construction management plan shall be written in accordance with London Best Practice Guidance and contain:a. A photographic condition survey of the public roads, footways and verges leading to the site. b. Details of construction access and associated traffic management. c. Arrangements for the loading, unloading and turning of delivery, construction and service vehicles. d. Arrangements for the parking of contractors' vehicles and construction staff travel plans.e. Arrangements for the storage of materials. f. Hours of work.g. The storage and removal of excavation material.h. Measures to reduce danger to cyclists.i. Dust mitigation measures. j. Membership of the Considerate Contractors Scheme The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved construction management plan unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority.k. Confirmation that all Non-Road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) of net power of 37kW and up to and including 560kW used during the course of the demolition, site preparation and construction phases shall comply with the emission standards set out in chapter 7 of the GLA's supplementary planning guidance "Control of Dust and Emissions During Construction and Demolition" dated July 2014 (SPG), or subsequent guidance. Unless it complies with the standards set out in the SPG, no NRMM shall be on site, at any time, whether in use or not, without the prior written consent of the local planning authority. The developer shall keep an up-to-date list of all NRMM used during the demolition, site preparation and construction phases of the development on the online register at https://nrmm.london/Reason: To ensure construction does not lead to damage of the nearby public road network and to minimise disruption to the neighbouring properties
The loading bay hereby approved must be constructed and completed prior to the occupation of the development. Reason: To ensure that the development is acceptably serviced.

No construction works or deliveries (loading/unloading) shall take place via the public highway without prior approval from the Local Planning Authority. Reason: To ensure that the public highway is not obstructed during construction and to minimise disruption to the road network and to neighbouring properties.

Prior to occupation, the development shall achieve a Certificate of Compliance to the relevant Secure by Design Guide(s) or alternatively achieve Crime Prevention Standards submitted to an approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority in conjunction with the Metropolitan Police. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and thereafter shall be fully retained and maintained as such for the lifetime of the development.Reason: In the interest of creating safer, secure, sustainable communities.

Prior to the occupation of the development the sustainable drainage strategy must be implemented in accordance with the approved drainage strategy and covering letter and maintained thereafter.Reason: To ensure the sustainable management of water, minimise flood risk, minimise discharge of surface water outside of the curtilage of the property and ensure that the drainage system will remain functional throughout the lifetime of the development in accordance with Policy CP28 of the Core Strategy and Policies SI12 and SI13 of the London Plan and the NPPF and to maximise opportunities for sustainable development, improve water quality, biodiversity, local amenity and recreation value

No development shall take place until a service and maintenance plan for the odour abatement systems is submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The service and maintenance plan must be adhered to and service and maintenance regularity shall increase should justifiable odour complaints be received by the Local Authority. Regularity of the servicing period shall only be decreased with the written agreement of the Local Planning Authority. Odours from cooking arising from the premises shall be undetectable at the boundary with the nearest or most affected residential properties.Reason: In the interests of odour abatement and to safeguard the amenity of neighbours.

No development shall take place until an acoustic report, written in line with the methodology in BS4142:2014+A1 2019, has been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The report must set out the sound level generated from the external mechanical pant and state the noise control measures to be employed to ensure the noise from the combined plant does not exceed a level of 10dB below the typical measured background noise level, measured as L(A)90 15 minutes, during operational hours, at the façade of the nearest or most noise affected residential property.Reason: To protect the local amenity from noise and disturbance
The restaurant premises shall only be open for business from Monday to Sunday between the hours of 0800 to midnight.Reason: To safeguard the amenity of the neighbours.

Prior to the occupation of the development details of the internal consumption of potable water must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Submitted details will demonstrate reduced water consumption through the use of water efficient fittings, appliances and recycling systems to show consumption equal to or less than 105 litres per person per day for the residential uses. The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved and maintained as such thereafter.Reason: To promote water conservation and efficiency measures in all new developments and where possible in the retrofitting of existing stock in accordance with Policies CP21 of the Core Strategy (2010) and DMD 58 of the Development Management Document (2014).

Notwithstanding the approved plans and documents, the development (including demolition, preparatory work and external works) shall not commence until a)	a scheme for the protection of T1 Lime, T2 Cedar and Group A Cypress (the retained trees), as shown on the Arboricultural Implications Plan 5173.Chase.TD.AIP, 21/12/2022, is submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority in order to ensure that the works do not have a detrimental impact on these retained trees. This scheme shall comprise a detailed Arboricultural Method Statement (AMS) and Tree Protection Plan (TPP) in accordance with BS 5837: 2012. These documents must demonstrate how retained trees will be protected by all aspects of the development including their siting and design and during implementation.The Project Arboricultrualist shall liaise with the design team, as appropriate, and agree the siting and design of all elements which could affect retained trees in order that the siting and design of the development is compatible with the requirements of retained trees.The AMS and TPP shall include details of siting, design and working measures in the RPA of retained trees to a scale and level of detail to demonstrate how the tree shall be protected.The AMS and TPP shall demonstrate how the retained trees shall be protected by the design and implementation of all aspects of the development the development including, but not limited to, the following:o	Removal of existing hard surfacingo	Hard surfacing / ground levelso	Drainageo	Utilitieso	Cultivation for soft landscaping o	Contractor's office and site welfareo	Construction activities.b) The development shall not commence until a schedule of arboricultural inspection and monitoring by a qualified arboriculturalist is submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Arboricultural inspection shall be undertaken for the following:o	Pre-commencement meeting with the Site Managero	Erection of tree protective fencing and ground protection prior to commencemento	Excavation for foundations in the RPA of T1o	Removal of hard surfacing and construction of new hard surfacing in the RPA of T1.o	The installation of utilities in the RPA of retained trees.A report should be submitted to the LPA within two weeks of each inspection outlining the following: Date of inspection, operations taking place on site, works inspected, key observations, photographs as applicable, recommendations made, anticipated date of next operation requiring arboricultural inspection and any arboricultural concerns.Reason: In the interests of tree protection and biodiversity.

Notwithstanding the approved plans and documents, prior to occupation, a verification report must be submitted to confirm that all arboricultural inspection has been and undertaken in accordance with the agreed programme identified in planning condition 20b). The verification report shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing. This report should include:o	Dates of arboricultural supervision.o	Operations supervised.o	Copy of arboricultural inspection reports.Reason: In the interests of tree protection and biodiversity.

The development shall not commence until details of existing planting to be retained and trees, shrubs and grass to be planted and the treatment of any hard surfaced amenity areas have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The site shall be landscaped in accordance with the approved details in the first planting season after completion or occupation of the development whichever is the sooner. Any trees or shrubs which die, becomes severely damaged or diseased within five years of planting shall be replaced with new planting in accordance with the approved details. Reason: To provide a satisfactory appearance and ensure that the development does not prejudice highway safety.

Prior to the occupation of the development, the details of the siting and design of 18 secure/covered and fully enclosed of long stay and 16 short stay cycle parking spaces must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved cycle parking must be installed prior to the occupation of the development and retained thereafter.Reason: To ensure the provision of cycle parking spaces is in line with the Council's adopted standards.

Prior to the occupation of the development, details of refuse storage facilities including facilities for the recycling of waste to be provided within the development, in accordance with the Enfield Council's Waste and Recycling Storage Planning Guidance (available at https://www.enfield.gov.uk/__data/assets/pdf_file/0015/5091/waste-and-recycling-storage-planning-guidance-planning.pdf) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The facilities shall be provided in accordance with the approved details before the development is occupied.Reason: In the interests of amenity and the recycling of waste materials in support of the Borough's waste reduction targets.

Prior to the occupation of the development, details of green sedum roofs and green walls must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Prior to the occupation of the development the approved details shall thereafter be installed, maintained and retained thereafter. Reason: In the interests of character and appearance, biodiversity, and sustainable drainage.

Prior to the occupation of the development, a Fire Statement, which is an independent fire strategy produced by a third party, suitably qualified assessor, shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing in consultation with the Fire Commissioner. The approved measures shall be implemented on site prior to the occupation of the development and shall be permanently maintained.Reason: In the interests of the safety of future occupiers.

Following practical completion of works a final Energy Performance Certificate shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Where applicable, a Display Energy Certificate shall be submitted within 18 months following first occupation.Reason: In the interest of sustainable development and to ensure that the Local Planning Authority may be satisfied that CO2 emission reduction targets are met in accordance with Policy CP20 of the Core Strategy, Policies in the London Plan and the NPPF.
description: Creation of 2nd and 3rd floors to accommodate 9 x residential units above restaurant together with single storey front, side and rear extension with mezzanine floor above, 1st floor front, side and rear involving balcony, outdoor seating areas, extractor system at rear with removal of an existing vehicular crossover and construction of loading bay.
